Articles.Content:
Unfortunatly, my flares don't show up like they should....

My sun has the same old yellow, but gets the round white appearance when half behind a planet,

how do I get the always bright white sun in space?

Btw very nice work on the whole thing

Did you replace the sharedassets file? If so, did you do it for the version you're using (32 bit or 64 bit)?

u cant drop; the old shardassets into the 64bit u probaly have to do it manualy if u go to the eve form and go to the original sunflare post u see how to extract it and add the flare yourself but dont know if it work on 64x

The first asset file link no longer works, is there anywhere else I can get it? I don't plan on using KSP x64 (not on this computer anyway). Does the second file work for x32 anyway?

Thanks.
just download the better atmospheres, the rar includes the assset file

just download the better atmospheres, the rar includes the assset file

Did that and it works, thanks!

Don't suppose anyone knows when the RSS.dll file will be updated do they (sorry if this has already been asked)?

There is a new RealSolarSystem.dll from 19.07.2014:

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/tree/master/RealSolarSystem/Plugins

Sorry for my incompetence I still don't understand how to get the flares to work :/

Edit: got it working now thanks!

Edited July 19, 2014 by montyben101

Hello

Is it possible to have the celestial Bodys look like do with this mod, without the volumetric clouds?

Cause my pc can't realy handle them e.g. if I want to start a rocket from Kerbin, the volumetric clouds bring down my Physics time ration to 0.2 and the fps below 15.

In space however, everything runs fine, so is it possible to have the Bodys look how they look now from afar, but without the volumetric clouds?

greez vogler
None of the dropbox links are working

I'm having a problem with either BA or EVE.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The sun flare works and is white from a distance, but the surface is yellow as is the flare up close. Kerbin no longer has that blue tint look. I have installed BA, so I don't know why it would still look like EVE clouds. All the files are there, as is that RSS.dll fix posted just above. From the surface the sky looks like how it should, not sure about the clouds though (clear skies over the KSC ).

Anyone else have this problem? AM I just being stupid? It's only been like this since 0.24 and I'm using the x32 version (my computer wouldn't benefit from the x64 version).
Did you installed Texture Replacer?

I'm having a problem with either BA or EVE.

http://imgur.com/a/FCrGg

The sun flare works and is white from a distance, but the surface is yellow as is the flare up close. Kerbin no longer has that blue tint look. I have installed BA, so I don't know why it would still look like EVE clouds. All the files are there, as is that RSS.dll fix posted just above. From the surface the sky looks like how it should, not sure about the clouds though (clear skies over the KSC ).

Anyone else have this problem? AM I just being stupid? It's only been like this since 0.24 and I'm using the x32 version (my computer wouldn't benefit from the x64 version).

EVE Clouds are still there because you still have the EVE config in there.
Well, might be a totally dump question, but how can BA be 0.24 ready while the required mods are still not complied against 0.24?

Well, might be a totally dump question, but how can BA be 0.24 ready while the required mods are still not complied against 0.24?

It still works in 0.24.

EVE Clouds are still there because you still have the EVE config in there.

Is that what the whole problem is? What about the lack of atmosphere colour changes?

EDIT: There is no other config file for your med. res mediafire link. I would try the dropbox link, but they don't work. I'll just use the one from 0.23.5 for now.

Edited July 20, 2014 by Iforgotthis
what changed from 0.23 version, ?

Is that what the whole problem is? What about the lack of atmosphere colour changes?

EDIT: There is no other config file for your med. res mediafire link. I would try the dropbox link, but they don't work. I'll just use the one from 0.23.5 for now.

I am having the same problem. Also when I remove the Eve cloud config it simply gets rid of the clouds completely.

(I am using 64x version though)

I have tested both the medium and high res versions to no avail.

Edited July 20, 2014 by Shasjas
does EVE and BA work on 64bit Windows? do I need to mess with the plugins or something?

I am having the same problem. Also when I remove the Eve cloud config it simply gets rid of the clouds completely.

(I am using 64x version though)

I have tested both the medium and high res versions to no avail.

I tried using the config file from 0.23.5, and with x32 0.24 that works fine.

I'm having a problem with either BA or EVE.

http://imgur.com/a/FCrGg

The sun flare works and is white from a distance, but the surface is yellow as is the flare up close. Kerbin no longer has that blue tint look. I have installed BA, so I don't know why it would still look like EVE clouds. All the files are there, as is that RSS.dll fix posted just above. From the surface the sky looks like how it should, not sure about the clouds though (clear skies over the KSC ).

Anyone else have this problem? AM I just being stupid? It's only been like this since 0.24 and I'm using the x32 version (my computer wouldn't benefit from the x64 version).

it seems like some layers are missing, do a clean re install for eve and BA, if that doesnt work manualy check for layers in eve controll menu. your clouds on kerbin appear like they are from BA though not EVE

- - - Updated - - -

everything works just fine

I'm getting console spam on KSP 64bit about the aurora and kerbin1 textures being messed up. EX: UnityException: Texture 'BoulderCo/Clouds/Textures/aurora' is not readable, the texture memory can not be accessed from scripts. You can make the texture readable in the Texture Import Settings. at (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.Texture2D:GetPixelBilinear (single,single)

at Clouds.CloudParticle.Update (UnityEngine.Texture2D tex) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.VolumeSection.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.VolumeManager.Update (Vector3 pos) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.CloudLayer.UpdateParticleClouds (Vector3 WorldPos) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.Clouds.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

I'm getting console spam on KSP 64bit about the aurora and kerbin1 textures being messed up. EX: UnityException: Texture 'BoulderCo/Clouds/Textures/aurora' is not readable, the texture memory can not be accessed from scripts. You can make the texture readable in the Texture Import Settings. at (wrapper managed-to-native) UnityEngine.Texture2D:GetPixelBilinear (single,single)

at Clouds.CloudParticle.Update (UnityEngine.Texture2D tex) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.VolumeSection.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.VolumeManager.Update (Vector3 pos) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.CloudLayer.UpdateParticleClouds (Vector3 WorldPos) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

at Clouds.Clouds.Update () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0

You might wanna take it up to Rbray first(The creator of EVE).

I've also fixed the Mediafire link for the medium res.

Is it possible to have the celestial Bodys look like do with this mod, without the volumetric clouds?

Cause my pc can't realy handle them e.g. if I want to start a rocket from Kerbin, the volumetric clouds bring down my Physics time ratio to 0.3 and the fps below 15.

In space however, everything runs fine, so is it possible to have the Bodys look how they look now from afar, but without the volumetric clouds?

What i need to use if i only want sun lense effect and changing suns color to white?

Edited July 21, 2014 by kiwiak
I don't see Kerbol as white. I see it as yellow. The only time I've seen it as white is when I'm right next to it.
